newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian goverment securities down in light trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian goverment securities down in light trade.

text.p: Prices of Indian government securities were slightly down in quiet trade Tuesday afternoon, dealers said.

They said volumes were light and some traders seemed to be selling ahead of a forthcoming bond auction. The government on Monday announced an auction of eight-year bonds worth 30 billion rupees for August 11.
"Normally bonds with such tenures attract attention from only insurance firms and provident funds," said a dealer.
"But right now, liquidity is good and there is all-round demand for stocks of all maturities. Some traders are looking to switch to the new stock," he said.

In latest deals, the 10.85 percent 2001 stock edged down to 100.80 rupees from Monday's closing 100.85, the 12.14 percent 2000 dropped to 104.33 from 104.37, while the 12.59 percent 2004 was steady at 106.0 rupees.
The 91-day treasury bill auctioned last Friday at a yield of 6.69 percent was traded on Tuesday at 6.55 percent.
